proposals.job_title: Full time Email Marketer | Funnelish and Klaviyo Expert
proposals.description:
We're looking for a smart, results-driven Email Marketer to join our fast-growing e-com team. Your main focus: build and scale email campaigns + flows for one of our core brands.

You’ll be in charge of the strategy, from ideation to execution. We value independence and initiative. No micromanagement, just impact.

---

What You’ll Do

- Create and manage email campaigns (3 per week minimum per GEO)
- Build automated flows to drive retention and upsells
- Identify winning campaigns and scale the...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to really "build and scale email campaigns + flows." That’s exactly the kind of thing I love sinking my teeth into.

Just last year, I helped a small e-commerce store that was drowning in abandoned carts. We didn't just automate; we personalized the recovery sequence based on items left behind, seeing a noticeable jump in conversions.

For your situation, I'd suggest first auditing your current flows and performance, then building out those 3+ campaigns/week focused on segmentation, and finally, fine-tuning everything through A/B testing. Using Funnelish and Klaviyo, we can easily find the sweet spot.

Sound good? I'm happy to chat more about your goals and see if I can help.

proposals.job_title: Technical Support for Typeform, Zapier, and Mailchimp Integration
proposals.description: We are seeking a skilled freelancer to assist with integrating Typeform surveys with Zapier and Mailchimp. The surveys have already been created, but we require expert support to ensure seamless connectivity and functionality. Your role will involve setting up the necessary workflows in Zapier to collect responses and automate email campaigns in Mailchimp. If you have experience in integrating these platforms and troubleshooting technical issues, we want to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Hi there,

Reading your description, I understand you need help ensuring "seamless connectivity and functionality" between Typeform, Zapier, and Mailchimp. I know that feeling; it's frustrating when these tools *should* talk, but don't.

I actually spent a solid afternoon last week troubleshooting a similar issue for a local non-profit. Turns out a seemingly minor setting in Zapier was the culprit, causing all kinds of headaches.

For your project, I’d suggest first thoroughly checking the API connections between all three platforms. Then, we can meticulously step through your Zapier workflows, response by response, to pinpoint any bottlenecks. Finally, we'll ensure the Mailchimp integration is segmenting and triggering emails correctly.

If you'd like to chat for 15 minutes to see if I'm a good fit, just let me know.

proposals.job_title: Playwright QA Engineer for SaaS Web App (Page Object Model Experience Required)
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced QA Engineer to help expand and maintain our Playwright end-to-end test suite for a SaaS web application. You will be responsible for writing robust, maintainable tests using the Page Object Model (POM) pattern, building on our existing POM structure.
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Key Pain Points Detected: manual processes" – that line jumped out at me. I totally get the frustration. Years ago, I spent weeks manually testing a checkout flow, only to find a critical bug five minutes after launch. Learned my lesson *hard* that day!

For your SaaS app, focusing on building out your existing POM structure sounds smart. My approach would be to first dive into your current setup to understand your patterns and standards. Then, I'd prioritize testing the riskiest areas (new features, critical flows). Finally, I'd ensure everything's properly documented for future maintenance.

Would love to chat more about your current test suite and how I can help take some of the manual burden off your team. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Appointment Setter - Commission Based
proposals.description:
About Us:
We’re a performance-driven marketing agency that helps businesses in the beauty, aesthetics, health & wellness, and medical sectors grow through omnichannel strategies, AI-powered automation, and revenue-focused campaigns.

We’re looking for a motivated and reliable freelance appointment setter to join us on a commission-only basis. If you're a strong communicator, have experience in outreach, and are comfortable initiating conversations with business owners—this is an opportunity to e...
proposals.message:
Hey there! I saw you're looking for an appointment setter, and the bit about "AI-powered automation" caught my eye. I've spent the last 20 years automating processes for businesses, often finding that the biggest bottleneck is simply getting people on the phone.

Funny enough, a while back, I helped a wellness clinic that felt exactly the same way - buried in manual outreach. We implemented a simple system using their existing CRM to automatically segment leads and personalize initial contact. This allowed us to dramatically reduce the human hours spent manually reaching out.

For you, I’d suggest starting with: 1) identifying key target business owners within your target industry, 2) personalizing initial outreach based on publicly available information, and 3) then creating a follow-up process to nurture leads until they're ready to book.

If this sounds like a sensible approach, I'm happy to jump on a quick call and discuss specifics.

proposals.job_title: GHL build

If you're open to a quick chat about your goals and how I can help streamline things, I'm happy to jump on a call. No pressure either way!

proposals.job_title: Develop API for USB Device Management in Linux
proposals.description: We are looking for a skilled developer to create an API that facilitates USB device access management among Linux users. The ideal candidate will implement a solution using udev or an alternative method to ensure secure and efficient device handling. Your expertise will be crucial in enabling user-specific access controls and enhancing overall system security. If you have a strong background in Linux environment and API development, we want to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"User-specific access controls and enhancing overall system security" with USB devices on Linux really jumped out at me. I remember wrestling with similar issues years ago trying to build a kiosk system for a library – ended up chasing my tail trying to handle permissions manually.

For your project, I'd start by digging into the current udev rules and identifying any bottlenecks. Then, I'd design a lightweight API to manage access, potentially wrapping udev or exploring alternatives depending on the specific security needs. Finally, thorough testing across a few common USB device types to ensure reliability.

I'd be happy to chat more about the details and see if my experience aligns well with what you're looking for. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Developer Needed To Build Facebook Marketplace Car Sniping Bot (Web Scraper + Alert System)
proposals.description:
I’m looking for an experienced developer to create a Facebook Marketplace bot that automatically scans newly listed used cars and alerts me when vehicles are significantly undervalued based on current market prices.

⚙️ Key Features Required:
	•	Real-time scraping of FB Marketplace car listings in specified regions (e.g., UK, specific cities).
	•	Ability to filter listings based on:
	•	Make, model, year, mileage
	•	Price under a custom threshold
	•	Keywords in title/description (e.g., “quick sal...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Automatically scans newly listed used cars and alerts me when vehicles are significantly undervalued" – I get it. I actually tried doing something similar years ago manually for motorcycles! What a time sink.

From my experience automating tasks like this, scraping Facebook Marketplace reliably needs a careful approach. A 3-step plan that I think would work well is: first, setting up a robust scraper to pull in the data from your regions, being mindful of FB's anti-bot measures. Second, we need to build the filtering logic based on make, model, etc., as you described. Finally, integrating an alert system so you get notified ASAP of those "quick sale" deals.

I'd be happy to chat more about how we can make this a reality for you. Let me know if you're up for a quick call!

proposals.job_title: Zapier Expert Needed for Restaurant Automation

Hey there,

Years ago, I spent a week wrestling with a similar setup involving a Cloudflare worker that kept throwing 502 errors. Turns out, it was just a rogue semicolon! Debugging taught me the importance of meticulousness, especially with all those interconnected modules.

For your project, I'd start by: 1) thoroughly reviewing the PDF documentation and unzipping that package to get a handle on everything. 2) Then, I'd tackle the technical setup in GoHighLevel and Make.com, focusing on security and GDPR compliance right out of the gate. 3) Finally, I'd fine-tune the SEO design to ensure your landing page is performing to its peak.

I'd be happy to jump on a quick call to chat more about your specific needs. Let me know if you’re free.

I remember when I first started with cloud automation years ago. It was tempting to skip the fundamentals, but quickly realised that solid understanding of the basics is essential for any project.

proposals.job_title: PC Script Development for Downloading Images from Shopify training
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create a script that allows us to download images and related data from our Shopify store directly to our local PC. The script should be efficient, easy to use, and capable of handling large volumes of images. Familiarity with Shopify's API and file management is essential. If you have a strong background in scripting and eCommerce data extraction, we would love to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Hey there! Just saw your project about needing a script to download images and data from your Shopify store to your PC – "efficient, easy to use, and capable of handling large volumes" – sounds like a time-saver for sure.

I remember years ago, I spent a week manually downloading product images for a client switching platforms. Never again!

My approach would be: 1) start by clarifying exactly what data you need alongside the images, 2) build a Python script using the Shopify API to pull that data and download the images in batches, and 3) create a simple interface so you can easily run the script and manage the downloads.

If you're free for a quick chat about the specifics of your Shopify store, I'd be happy to brainstorm a bit.

proposals.job_title: Experienced Frontend Developer Needed for Responsive Web Application

Finally, thorough testing on different devices and browsers is crucial to ensure responsiveness.

Would love to chat more about your specific requirements and how I can contribute. Are you free for a quick call sometime next week?

proposals.job_title: Direct Post from Landbot to Ping/Post Platform (Webhook Zapier connection)
proposals.description:
I need your help making an integration between Landbot and Standard Information (a ping/post platform). We need to direct post leads from Landbot to Standard Information.  Landbot has webhook/zapier support. Standard Information is not on Zapier. 

I'm attaching a direct post code example from Standard Information. We need to pass the submission from Landbot.io to Standard Information. That's basically it. Please only bid on this if you can do it now in the next 2 hours.
proposals.message:
Okay, I get it. "Direct post leads from Landbot to Standard Information... in the next 2 hours." That immediacy is a challenge I can appreciate.

I actually just wrapped up a similar project moving data from a Typeform to a proprietary CRM, and the trickiest part wasn't the Zapier setup, but massaging the data into the precise format the CRM expected. Your direct post code example is crucial – thanks for including it.

Here's how I'd tackle this: 1) I'll carefully review the Standard Information code to understand the required data structure. 2) I'll build a Zapier flow to grab the Landbot data and format it according to those specs. 3) Finally, I'll use Zapier's Webhooks by Zapier to post to Standard Information.

If you're free for a quick chat to clarify any field mappings, I can probably knock this out within that timeframe. Let me know!

proposals.job_title: Cold Outreach Campaign Specialist (Multi-Channel, Personalised)

proposals.job_title: Collaboration Opportunity: AI-Powered IVF Virtual Training Assistant

Would be keen to chat more about the specific challenges you're encountering and see if my experience aligns. Let me know if you're free for a quick call."

proposals.job_title: SEO Crowd Marketing (Quora, Reddit)

Then, I'd prioritize crafting truly helpful answers and comments, integrating links *very* naturally only when they add genuine value to the discussion. Finally, diligent monitoring and adjustment based on community feedback would be key.

As a Google Analytics Developer, you will be responsible for implementing key triggers and data elements into our Next.js website using best practices for Google Analytics to generate th...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're launching a new Next.js eCommerce site and need deep insights into traffic and purchase behavior. Makes sense, getting GA4 right from the start is crucial!

I remember helping a client migrate to GA4 last year, and the biggest headache was retroactively mapping their existing events to the new data model. We ended up spending way too much time cleaning up the data.

For your project, I'd suggest first diving into the existing Next.js setup, then creating a clear event tracking plan tailored to your specific customer journey, and finally implementing those events with best-practice GA4 code and debugging.

Would love to chat briefly about your store and how you envision tracking those key interactions. Let me know if you're free for a quick call!

proposals.job_title: Full-stack dev with attention to visual detail
proposals.description:
My client has a Ferry Booking system (via custom API - no documentatiion. I will act as middleman). We tried to implement the query & booking & payment system. While doing so, unfortunately the developer is no longer available to complete the work. So we need to re-implement the frontend again with the updates (without changing a dot (client is very strict on exact frontend)).
Current setup is pure HTML pages. You will need to work on HTML pages and JavaScript only... Like I said, client is very...
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt:

Hey there,

"Need to re-implement the frontend again...client is very strict on exact frontend" - I definitely understand the need to respect an existing, visually-defined product! I once spent a week recreating a specific font rendering bug for a client because *removing* it was a deal-breaker for them.

For this ferry booking system, I'd start by thoroughly reverse-engineering the existing HTML and Javascript to fully understand the interactions. Then, working closely with you as the middleman, implement the necessary updates while *exactly* preserving the current look and feel. After that, rigorous testing across different browsers to ensure pixel-perfect parity.

If you think this sounds good, I'm happy to hop on a quick call to discuss the API and specific challenges in more detail.

proposals.job_title: Full Stack AI Automation and Web Scraping Engineer Needed
proposals.description: We are seeking a skilled Full Stack AI Automation and Web Scraping Engineer to enhance our data-driven projects. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing automated systems using AI technologies and extracting data from various web sources. You will work on building efficient pipelines for data collection and processing, as well as implementing machine learning models. A strong understanding of both front-end and back-end development is essential. If you are passionate about automat...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to really streamline your data-driven projects with automation, specifically tackling web scraping and AI implementation. That resonates – I've spent the last 20 years neck-deep in this stuff.

I actually just wrapped up a project where the client was manually compiling market research data; it was taking them weeks. By building a custom scraping tool integrated with a basic NLP model, we cut that down to a few hours.

For you, I'd think we could start with a quick audit of your current data collection process, then build out a robust scraping pipeline, and finally look at integrating some AI tools to automate analysis and reporting.

If this approach sounds interesting, I'm happy to jump on a quick call to chat through the specifics. No pressure either way.

proposals.job_title: Offline AI Coding Assistant Development
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create an offline AI coding assistant using Ollama-supported models that can run locally. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in AI model integration and possess the ability to tailor the assistant for coding tasks. Responsibilities include designing the system architecture, implementing the model, and ensuring optimal performance. If you have a passion for AI and coding, and are ready to tackle a challenging project, we want to hear from you! Write...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking to build an offline AI coding assistant – "tackle a challenging project" indeed! I've been tinkering with local AI models for a while now. Actually, just last month I was trying to get a similar setup running on a Raspberry Pi for a personal project, and learned a few things the hard way about optimizing performance on limited resources.

Here's how I'd approach it for you: First, a deep dive into selecting the right Ollama model for your specific coding needs. Then, designing a lean system architecture that prioritizes speed and offline functionality. Finally, rigorous testing to ensure it's actually helpful and not just spitting out random code snippets.

Would love to chat more about your vision for the assistant and see if my experience aligns with what you're hoping to achieve. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.
